snippet: Nine months into his tenure as F.B.I. director, James B. Comey acknowledges that he underestimated the threat the United States still faces from terrorism.
abstract: FBI Director James B Comey, who came into office nine months earlier intent on shifting focus to traditional criminal prosecutions, now says he underestimated continuing threat of terrorism; has maintained legacy of predecessor Robert S Mueller III, under which half of agency's agents and analysts remain focused on national security issues; critics say that Comey's FBI has not sufficiently adapted to evolution of terror threats since Sept 11 attacks.
lead_paragraph: Nine months into his tenure as F.B.I. director, James B. Comey acknowledges that he underestimated the threat the United States still faces from terrorism.

headline.main: At F.B.I., Change in Leaders Didn’t Change Focus on Terror
headline.print_headline: At F.B.I., Change in Leaders Didn’t Change Focus on Terror
